page.title: 20LOCAL SURVEY
page.content: Surveying one road on a local housing estate in Alcester it was discovered that only one quarter of the people actually worked in Alcester The majority travelled at least five miles to their place of work.Three quarters of those asked said they travelled to either Stratford or Redditch to do their bulk shopping and only used the local shops for emergencies.This is understandable as there is no really large supermarket in Alcester.There are high quality shops, however, which offer a good service to those who cannot travel. Looking at transport in the 1980's we asked every child in our school how many cars in the family.We found out that half had two or more cars.A result of transport cuts and the fact that more mums work and need cars. .
